update.description:
This pull request adds the ability to re-attach the `HarnessPlugin` via a new gazebo topic that accepts a pose message. If the harness joint has already been detached, the model is teleported to the new pose and then re-attached. The new functionality is added to an existing test, and another example standalone program is added for attaching the plugin.

There is a fair bit of re-factoring here, so I could split this into multiple pull requests if necessary, ~~though it is fairly urgent for the SRC project, so please let me know soon if I should split it up~~ (Edit: the SRC won't use this version of the plugin; it will be committed into the srcsim repo, so there is less of a rush for this upstream pull request). Here is a summary of the changes:

* 743d1ac: fix race condition seg-fault (back-ported to gazebo7 in pull request #2696)
* 30a9ac1: use private data pointer
* aaea978: move topic subscriptions to plugin Init so callbacks don't happen too soon (compilation fixed in  e55b7d2)
* e55b7d2: move joint creation from Load to private function Attach()
* 700c90c, 2909d41, acec026: new Attach API
* c7a082b: set pose of detach link instead of canonical link if they are not the same (noticed while testing with Valkyrie in srcsim)
update.title: HarnessPlugin: PIMPL and allow re-attaching

content.raw:
the valkyrie model is hosted on [gitlab](https://gitlab.com/nasa-jsc-robotics/val_description), and there is an outdated version in a [gazebo_models pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/173/added-valkyrie-model/diff)

it might be easier to use a fully-populated urdf like the following which is more recent than the one in that pull request

* https://gist.github.com/scpeters/18c47ae2b0d4e8c2d339df88daa922e9
content.html:
the valkyrie model is hosted on gitlab, and there is an outdated version in a gazebo_models pull request

it might be easier to use a fully-populated urdf like the following which is more recent than the one in that pull request

  • https://gist.github.com/scpeters/18c47ae2b0d4e8c2d339df88daa922e9

content.raw: By the way, where could I find the Valkyrie model? It would be nice to have for harness testing since it was the main use case so far.
content.html: By the way, where could I find the Valkyrie model? It would be nice to have for harness testing since it was the main use case so far.

content.raw: @pchorak if you're working on the harness, you may want to consider reviewing this PR as well
content.html: @pchorak if you're working on the harness, you may want to consider reviewing this PR as well

update.description:
This pull request adds the ability to re-attach the `HarnessPlugin` via a new gazebo topic that accepts a pose message. If the harness joint has already been detached, the model is teleported to the new pose and then re-attached. The new functionality is added to an existing test, and another example standalone program is added for attaching the plugin.

There is a fair bit of re-factoring here, so I could split this into multiple pull requests if necessary, ~~though it is fairly urgent for the SRC project, so please let me know soon if I should split it up~~ (Edit: the SRC won't use this version of the plugin; it will be committed into the srcsim repo, so there is less of a rush for this upstream pull request). Here is a summary of the changes:

* 743d1ac: fix race condition seg-fault (back-ported to gazebo7 in pull request #2696)
* 30a9ac1: use private data pointer
* aaea978: move topic subscriptions to plugin Init so callbacks don't happen too soon (compilation fixed in  e55b7d2)
* e55b7d2: move joint creation from Load to private function Attach()
* 700c90c, 2909d41, acec026: new Attach API
* c7a082b: set pose of detach link instead of canonical link if they are not the same (noticed while testing with Valkyrie in srcsim)
update.title: HarnessPlugin: PIMPL and allow re-attaching

content.raw: I updated the `SetWorldPose` arithmetic in c7a082b after some testing with Valkyrie in srcsim, and we should add another test in which the detach link is not the canonical link of the model, and then verify that the detach link pose matches the pose sent to the attach function.
content.html: I updated the SetWorldPose arithmetic in c7a082b after some testing with Valkyrie in srcsim, and we should add another test in which the detach link is not the canonical link of the model, and then verify that the detach link pose matches the pose sent to the attach function.
